text.*:
The Owl Library

Chapter Info

Volume:

112

Chapter:

1134

Japanese Title:

フクロウの図書館

Romanized Title:

Fukurō no Toshokan

Viz Title:

The Owl Library

Pages:

19

Release Date:

December 23, 2024

WSJ Issue:

2025 Issue 4-5
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1134 is titled "The Owl Library".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates with water guns riding on a giant Franky mecha across the sea.

Short Summary[]

Luffy and Saul give their thanks to each other for what they did for Robin. Lilith then reveals that once she builds a new laboratory she can revive a clone of Vegapunk. Saul's assistant Ange then appears and offers to give a tour. During the tour the Straw Hats learn about the late King Harald. As Robin learns about the Owl Library, Loki talks to a mysterious individual and elsewhere two figures magically appear in the Elbaph village.

Long Summary[]

Luffy greets and thanks Saul for helping Robin in the past, all the while talking like a yakuza, to the confusion of his crewmates. Robin introduces Luffy for him but Saul states he is aware of Luffy's reputation. Still, he is relieved that Robin was able to find the friends who would protect her like he knew she would, and she calls the Straw Hats her true friends, causing all of them (except for Luffy, Zoro and Jinbe) to cry their eyes out once more, saying they would die for her.

Saul greets the rest of the crew and commends them for reaching Elbaph before apologizing for his earlier prank, revealing that the woman who was calling for help earlier, Ange, is actually his assistant and she was in on the prank the entire time. Saul tells Luffy he is impressed he is now recognized as one of the Four Emperors and asks that he continues to protect Robin, to which he happily agrees.

Lilith then appears and flies over to Saul, though at first, Saul does not recognize her until Lilith introduces herself. Jinbe and Gerd then help deliver a large box to Lilith, which she instructed him to bring from Egghead, and when he asks what is in it, Lilith reveals it contains a perfect clone of Dr. Vegapunk, which is what he used to visit Elbaph twenty years ago so as not to arouse suspicion from the World Government. Lilith states she will not be able to extract the clone until she gets the necessary equipment, which is why she plans on building a new lab. Bonney, who was also there, asks Lilith if she will be able to help Kuma, and she tells her she intends to.

Some kids then peek out from behind a tree asking if Saul is done and if they can play now, and he tells them to go for it. Ange introduces herself to the crew and reveals the kids usually play by the Warrior Spring but the two of them told them to wait until after the reunion. She offers to give everyone a tour, but Luffy and Usopp immediately run off by themselves towards the Walrus School, which Saul opened up twenty years ago per King Harald's request. Ange offers to give the rest of the crew a tour while Saul takes Robin to the Owl Library.

Luffy and Usopp come across some giant children who want to play prisoners with the crew, but some other kids tell them to stop because they are not supposed to neither hurt humans nor refer to them as "shorties," and the kids relent. Usopp is confused by the kids' mellowness and asks if they are not supposed to be fighters, but the kids say fighting is dangerous. The Straw Hats get an explanation by the children's teacher, a woman named Ripley, whom the crew were unknowingly standing on.

Ripley tells the Straw Hats that the legends about fearsome giant pirates are all 100 years old; today giants are more peaceful as King Harald wanted the giants to trade with other nations rather than plunder, and though the giants considered him a revolutionary who wanted to change Elbaph for the better, he was ultimately slain by Loki, and as such the giants refuse to consider him their new king, thereby leaving the country without a ruler. While everyone begins the tour of the school, Ripley asks Luffy about his transformation, which she said reminds her of a legendary warrior from Elbaph's stories, as she is from the last generation of warriors from that time.

Robin and Saul, along with Chopper, Lilith and Bonney, visit the Owl Library. Saul explains that he went back to Ohara with Hajrudin to salvage the books. He warns Robin to be careful and sure enough, once she steps inside, the book in her hand grows to giant-size. Saul explains this is an unnatural ability of the library, but he is more thrilled to be able to share all of the knowledge he saved from the island with Robin, who is brought to tears to see all of her island's books.

Down in the Underworld, Loki chats with someone named Mosa and he asks them if the moment of fear they experienced still motivates them, which Mosa confirms. Loki muses how even though the two of them have never met face-to-face, he considers Mosa a friend, and declares if he were in Mosa's place, he would have destroyed everyone present. Though Mosa does not approve of Loki's violence, they are beginning to notice the essence of kindness coming from Loki's harsh words, which the disgraced prince vehemently denies.

While the other giants are celebrating, a bolt of black lightning strikes the nearby castle and a magic circle appears on the floor. Within the circle are two hooded figures: a man and a woman.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • Lilith reveals that a clone of Vegapunk "Stella" was brought with them from Egghead.
    • This clone was the Vegapunk who visited Elbaph 20 years ago.
    • Lilith intends to build a new laboratory on Elbaph to extract the clone from the bio-fluid container and to restore Kuma's mind.
  • The Owl Library and the Walrus School are detailed.
    • Ange the librarian and Ripley the biology teacher are introduced.
    • It is revealed that Elbaph children are no longer trained to be warriors due to King Harald's reforms.
    • The Owl Library has the power to gigantify books inside it.
  • Loki talks with a mysterious acquaintance called Mosa via Den Den Mushi.
  • A man and a woman arrive on Elbaph via a magic circle.

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


Thank you to all the creators who contributed to the Yurui One Piece Magazine! It was a blast to read!


ワンマガ「ゆるいOP」にご協力頂いた作家の皆様に感謝!!大変楽しく拝読しました!!

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.

Trivia[]

  • The Giant Mecha Franky in the cover story is a tribute to Kazuki Yao, the Japanese voice actor for Franky, who was announced to be retiring from the role a few weeks prior to Chapter 1134 being released. With Episode 1111, which was released prior to the anime's six-month break, being his final performance.
    • Yao's "graduation ceremony" from the character was held on December 22 at Jump Festa 2025, a day prior to this chapter's debut.

'''Chapter 1134''' is titled "The Owl Library". 

==Cover Page==
[[Cover Page#Color Spread|Color Spread]]: The [[Straw Hat Pirates]] with water guns riding on a giant [[Franky]] mecha across the sea.

==Short Summary==
[[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] and [[Jaguar D. Saul|Saul]] give their thanks to each other for what they did for [[Nico Robin|Robin]]. [[Vegapunk/Lilith|Lilith]] then reveals that once she builds a new laboratory she can revive a clone of [[Vegapunk]]. Saul's assistant [[Ange]] then appears and offers to give a tour. During the tour the Straw Hats learn about the late King [[Harald]]. As Robin learns about the Owl Library, [[Loki]] talks to a mysterious individual and elsewhere [[Figarland Shamrock|two]] [[Gunko|figures]] magically appear in the [[Elbaph]] village.

==Long Summary==
[[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] greets and thanks [[Jaguar D. Saul|Saul]] for helping [[Nico Robin|Robin]] in the past, all the while talking like a yakuza, to the confusion of his crewmates. Robin introduces Luffy for him but Saul states he is aware of Luffy's reputation. Still, he is relieved that Robin was able to find the friends who would protect her like he knew she would, and she calls the Straw Hats her true friends, causing all of them (except for Luffy, [[Roronoa Zoro|Zoro]] and [[Jinbe]]) to cry their eyes out once more, saying they would die for her.

Saul greets the rest of the crew and commends them for reaching [[Elbaph]] before apologizing for his earlier prank, revealing that the woman who was calling for help earlier, [[Ange]], is actually his assistant and she was in on the prank the entire time. Saul tells Luffy he is impressed he is now recognized as one of the [[Four Emperors]] and asks that he continues to protect Robin, to which he happily agrees.

[[Vegapunk/Lilith|Lilith]] then appears and flies over to Saul, though at first, Saul does not recognize her until Lilith introduces herself. Jinbe and [[Gerd]] then help deliver a large box to Lilith, which she instructed him to bring from [[Egghead]], and when he asks what is in it, Lilith reveals it contains a perfect [[Cloning|clone]] of [[Vegapunk|Dr. Vegapunk]], which is what he used to visit Elbaph twenty years ago so as not to arouse suspicion from the [[World Government]]. Lilith states she will not be able to extract the clone until she gets the necessary equipment, which is why she plans on building a new lab. [[Jewelry Bonney|Bonney]], who was also there, asks Lilith if she will be able to help [[Bartholomew Kuma|Kuma]], and she tells her she intends to.

Some kids then peek out from behind a tree asking if Saul is done and if they can play now, and he tells them to go for it. Ange introduces herself to the crew and reveals the kids usually play by the Warrior Spring but the two of them told them to wait until after the reunion. She offers to give everyone a tour, but Luffy and [[Usopp]] immediately run off by themselves towards the Walrus School, which Saul opened up twenty years ago per [[Harald|King Harald's]] request. Ange offers to give the rest of the crew a tour while Saul takes Robin to the Owl Library.

Luffy and Usopp come across some giant children who want to play prisoners with the crew, but some other kids tell them to stop because they are not supposed to neither hurt humans nor refer to them as "shorties," and the kids relent. Usopp is confused by the kids' mellowness and asks if they are not supposed to be fighters, but the kids say fighting is dangerous. The Straw Hats get an explanation by the children's teacher, a woman named [[Ripley]], whom the crew were unknowingly standing on.

Ripley tells the [[Straw Hat Pirates|Straw Hats]] that the legends about fearsome giant pirates are all 100 years old; today giants are more peaceful as King Harald wanted the giants to trade with other nations rather than plunder, and though the giants considered him a revolutionary who wanted to change Elbaph for the better, he was ultimately slain by Loki, and as such the giants refuse to consider him their new king, thereby leaving the country without a ruler. While everyone begins the tour of the school, Ripley asks Luffy about his [[Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 5 Techniques|transformation]], which she said reminds her of a [[Nika|legendary warrior]] from Elbaph's stories, as she is from the last generation of warriors from that time.

Robin and Saul, along with [[Tony Tony Chopper|Chopper]], Lilith and Bonney, visit the Owl Library. Saul explains that he went back to [[Ohara]] with [[Hajrudin]] to salvage the books. He warns Robin to be careful and sure enough, once she steps inside, the book in her hand grows to giant-size. Saul explains this is an unnatural ability of the library, but he is more thrilled to be able to share all of the knowledge he saved from the island with Robin, who is brought to tears to see all of her island's books.

Down in the Underworld, [[Loki]] chats with someone named [[Mosa]] and he asks them if the moment of fear they experienced still motivates them, which Mosa confirms. Loki muses how even though the two of them have never met face-to-face, he considers Mosa a friend, and declares if he were in Mosa's place, he would have destroyed everyone present. Though Mosa does not approve of Loki's violence, they are beginning to notice the essence of kindness coming from Loki's harsh words, which the disgraced prince vehemently denies.

While the other giants are celebrating, a bolt of black lightning strikes the nearby castle and a [[Abyss|magic circle]] appears on the floor. Within the circle are two hooded figures: a [[Figarland Shamrock|man]] and a [[Gunko|woman]].
